def: To cast reproaches and sneering expressions; to rail; to uttertaunting, sarcastic words; to flout; to fleer; to scoff.Fleer and gibe, and laugh and flout. Swift.
Positive; affirming confidently; affirmative; peremptory.In a confident and assertive form. Glanvill.As*sert"ive*ly, adv.-- As*sert"ive*ness, n.

Pertaining to, or containing, iron; chalybeate; as, martialpreparations. [Archaic] Martial flowers (Med.), a reddish crystallinesalt of iron; the ammonio-chloride of iron. [Obs.] -- Martial law,the law administered by the military power of a government when ithas superseded the civil authority in time of war, or when the civilauthorities are unable to enforce the laws. It is distinguished frommilitary law, the latter being the code of rules for the regulationof the army and navy alone, either in peace or in war.
Of or pertaining to glosses or to a glossary; containing aglossary.
To score with a peg, as points in the game; as, she peggedtwelwe points. [Colloq.]
Action or appearance resembling that of a puppet, or puppetshow; hence, mere form or show; affectation.Puppetry of the English laws of divorce. Chambers.
Quality, state, or degree, of a multivalent element, atom, orradical.
The act of sustaining; maintenance; support. Milton. Lowell.
Having power, capacity, or tendency to absorb or imbibe. E.Darwin.

Designating, or pertaining to, a certain class of diseases. SeeZymotic disease, below. Zymotic disease (Med.), any epidemic,endemic, contagious, or sporadic affection which is produced by somemorbific principle or organism acting on the system like a ferment.
